traineritems.l1_text: All the birds are already here, all the birds, all!
traineritems.l2_text: Alle Vögel sind schon da, alle Vögel, alle! {00000}

traineritems.l1_text: What singing, music-making, whistling, chirping, warbling!
traineritems.l2_text: Welch' ein Singen, Musizieren, Pfeifen, Zwitschern, Tirilieren! {9000}

traineritems.l1_text: Spring now wants to come (lit. invade), comes with song and sound.
traineritems.l2_text: Frühling will nun einmarschieren, kommt mit Gesang und Schalle. {19000}

traineritems.l1_text: How jolly they all are, nimbly and cheerfully they move!
traineritems.l2_text: Wie sie alle lustig sind, flink und froh sich regen! {28000}

traineritems.l1_text: Blackbird, thrush, finch and starling and the whole flock of birds
traineritems.l2_text: Amsel, Drossel, Fink und Star und die ganze Vogelschar {37000}

traineritems.l1_text: wish you a happy year, nothing but well-being and blessings! Blessings...
traineritems.l2_text: wünschen dir ein frohes Jahr, lauter Heil und Segen! Segen... {46000}

traineritems.l1_text: The Song
The name of this classical night song is "Alle Vögel sind schon da" (=All the ((*birds|kids)) are already here).
"Alle Vögel sind schon da" is one of the most popular traditional songs about spring. The text was written by Hoffmann von Fallersleben (1798-1874), a well known German poet.
Learn some phrases from the song
all the birds are already here (lit. there)
what singing, music-making
whistling, chirping, warbling
spring now wants to come (lit. invade)
comes with song and sound
All the birds are already here, all the birds, all!
traineritems.l2_text: ((Alle Vögel)) sind schon da, alle Vögel, alle!

traineritems.l1_text: What singing, music-making,
whistling, chirping, warbling!
Spring now wants to come (lit. invade),
comes with song and sound.
Learn some phrases from the song
how jolly they all are
blackbird, thrush
finch and starling
and the whole flock of birds wish you
a happy year, nothing but well-being and blessings
traineritems.l2_text: ((ein frohes Jahr)), lauter Heil und Segen
traineritems.info_text: The German word "lauter" means "nothing but" or "lots of".

traineritems.l1_text: How jolly they all are,
nimbly and cheerfully they move!
Blackbird, thrush, finch and starling
and the whole flock of birds
wish you a happy year,
nothing but well-being and blessings! Blessings...
Put the lyrics in the right order
All the birds are already here, all the birds, all!
What a singing, music-making, whistling, chirping, warbling!
Spring now wants to come (lit. invade), comes with song and sound.
How jolly they all are, nimbly and cheerfully they move!
Blackbird, thrush, finch and starling and the whole flock of birds…
wish you a happy year, nothing but well-being and blessings!
